description: Keeping our Washington national guard strong act.

original.text:
H-0276.2
HOUSE BILL 1073
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Leavitt, Abbarno, Ryu, Shavers, Paul, Timmons, Simmons, Rule, Barnard, Nance, Reeves, and Donaghy
Prefiled 12/16/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Technology, Economic Development, & Veterans.
AN ACT Relating to keeping our Washington national guard strong act; and adding a new section to chapter 38.24 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 38.24 RCW to read as follows:
(1) Subject to the availability of amounts appropriated for this specific purpose, there is created the Washington national guard retention program.
(2) The adjutant general shall establish the program to study retention needs, including length of service and critical skills retention. The adjutant general may consider the reenlistment term, conversion to a shortage specialty, and other retention factors to determine the amount of any reenlistment bonus that will encourage members of the Washington national guard to extend their terms of service.
(3) The adjutant general shall determine eligibility criteria for the retention program. The criteria must be specified in policy and changes must be published.
(4) The adjutant general shall determine the amount of any reenlistment bonus and the schedule to make bonus payments.
(5) The state military department must report to the governor and the legislature on retention needs and recommendations at least once every three years, beginning November 1, 2027.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The bill aims to create a retention program for the Washington National Guard to help maintain and strengthen its forces. This initiative intends to address issues related to the retention of service members by offering incentives such as reenlistment bonuses. Key changes include the establishment of eligibility criteria and requirements for ongoing reporting to the governor and legislature about retention needs and recommendations.

Key Provisions

Washington National Guard Retention Program

  • A new program is created to focus on the retention of National Guard members.
  • The adjutant general is responsible for studying retention needs, considering factors like length of service and critical skills.
  • Factors affecting reenlistment bonuses will include:
    • Reenlistment term
    • Conversion to a shortage specialty
    • Other relevant retention factors
  • The adjutant general will set eligibility criteria that must be clearly published.
  • Bonus amounts and the schedule for bonus payments will be determined by the adjutant general.
  • The state military department is required to report to the governor and legislature at least once every three years, starting from November 1, 2027, on the retention needs and recommendations.
